subject: Re: [junit] Custom MethodSorter
msgSnippet: Have the seed outputted for that test run and, if they fail, have a way to specify that same seed for another run? ... [Non-text portions of this message have
messageBody:
Have the seed outputted for that test run and, if they fail, have a way to
specify that same seed for another run?

On 5 December 2012 20:58, Kevin Cooney <kcooney@...> wrote:

> If it was random, how would you reproduce the problem if a particular
> ordering caused a failure?
>
> IMHO, doing this would make the test suite appear flaky. Flaky tests
> produce a broken window affect. In other words, when many developers see
> flaky tests, they just keep re-running them until they pass.
>
> -- Kevin
>
> On Wed, Dec 5, 2012 at 12:41 PM, James Shaw <js102@...> wrote:
>
> > **
> >
> >
> > I'd like to see a random method sorter. That would give better confidence
> > that your tests *are* independent. Is it worth raising a ticket for this?
> >
> >
> > On 5 December 2012 17:14, Kevin Cooney <kcooney@...> wrote:
> >
> > > Question: why do you want your own method sorter? As Matthew mentioned
> in
> > > his StackOverflow response, it's best to make test methods not
> dependent
> > on
> > > each other
> > >
> > > -- Kevin
> > >
> > > On Wed, Dec 5, 2012 at 4:27 AM, Eirik Lygre <eirik.lygre@...>
> > wrote:
> > >
> > > > **
> >
> > > >
> > > >
> > > > I'm looking at creating my own MethodSorter. Is there documentation
> on
> > > how
> > > > to do that, and is it even possible?
> > > >
> > > > --
> > > > Eirik
> > > >
> > > > There is no high like a tango high
> > > > There is no low like a tango low
> > > >
